definition: turning point/breaking point/inflexion point (math., a point of a curve at which the curvature changes sign)
to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: The point of minima value and the point of inflexion are two common concepts of derivative.

sentences.english: In his opinion, we are at a turning poing for SOA.
sentences.chinese: 在他看来，我们正处于SOA的拐点。

sentences.english: New cars come forth continuously mid and high-class cars meet a new inflexion?

sentences.english: For a lot of college students, the new semester is just around the corner.
sentences.chinese: 在一些大学生看来，新学期正好进入一个拐点。

The Jam is, in fact, an "inflection point" in the life of the community.

sentences.english: But rental markets are tightening and builders are already talking about inflection points.

sentences.english: I think we are at an inflection point.
sentences.chinese: 我认为，我们正处于拐点。

sentences.english: The Egyptian revolution is at a difficult inflection point.
sentences.chinese: 埃及革命正进入一个艰难的拐点。

definition: specific to a particular stage (of a project etc)/interim (policy etc)/occurring in stages/phased
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
to slow down/to ease up/to abate/slowdown/downturn
market price/quotation of market price/the current market situation
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
